title: Torque and alpha - two pulleys touching at edge

content.question: Two pulleys are in contact at their outer edges, as shown in the figure. Each pulley rotates about an axle located at its center, and the pulleys do not slip against each other when they rotate. Pulley <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> on the left has a radius <math alttext="r sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and rotational inertia <math alttext="l sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, and Pulley <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> on the right has radius <math alttext="r sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and rotational inertia <math alttext="I sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. Additionally, a string wrapped around the pulley on the left is pulled with a constant force of magnitude <math alttext="F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. If friction in the pulley axles is negligible, what is the magnitude of the angular acceleration of Pulley <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>?
